[[Giant Records (Warner Bros. subsidiary label)|Giant]] | associated_acts = | website = | current_members = | past_members = Gates Foss
Scot Foss
Jeff Foss
James Foss }} '''Zaca Creek''' was an American [[country music]] group formed in 1989. The band consisted of brothers Gates, Scot, Jeff and James Foss. Their debut single, "Sometimes Love's Not a Pretty Thing," was their only song to reach the Top 40 of the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles]] chart, peaking at No. 38. It was included on their eponymous debut album, issued in 1989 on [[Columbia Records]]. The group was signed by [[Giant Records (Warner Bros. subsidiary label)|Giant Records]] in 1992, who released their second album, ''Broken Heartland''. The band broke up in 1994. In 1991, Zaca Creek was shortlisted for the [[Academy of Country Music Award for New Vocal Duo or Group of the Year]].{{cite magazine|url=https://www.worldradiohistory.com/Archive-All-Music/Billboard/90s/1991/BB-1991-02-02.pdf|title=Academy Of Country Music Names Award Nominees|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|pages=41|date=February 2, 1991}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" !
